alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa; Pinal; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 09 at 4:27PM MST until September 09 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... East central La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northeastern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 427 PM MST, areas of dust were being generated by several outflow boundaries from storms extending from Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station to 8 miles northwest of Estrella Sailport to near Queen Creek, moving northeast in varying directions. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 62 and 126, and between mile markers 155 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 88 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 59 and 87, and between mile markers 173 and 213. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Casa Grande, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Gila Bend, Gold Canyon and Tonopah. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
